creator: stategyman@gmail.com
text:
So I'm using jnetpcap in a sampler of my own, and building in Ant succeeds, but when I try to run it inside JMeter I received a:

jmeter.threads.JMeterThread: Test failed! java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no jnetpcap in java.library.path

Even though not only is the jnetpcap.jar file in the lib folder (as instructed in the JMeter docs) but I also tried setting user-path:../lib/jnetpcap.jar  , which loads correctly as shown in the logs:

2012/07/09 15:45:42 INFO  - jmeter.JMeter: user.classpath=../lib/jnetpcap.jar 
2012/07/09 15:45:42 INFO  - jmeter.JMeter: Adding to classpath: ../lib/jnetpcap.jar 

But the sampler still returns the no jnetpcap in lava.library.path error.

Any ideas? I seem to have followed the instructions but the outside jars don't seem to work.

Hello,
Bugzilla is not a support forum.
Please use JMeter User Mailing list to ask your question which I will answer there.


Regards
Philippe
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
stategyman@gmail.com
text:
Ah yes, well, I figured it might be a bug, but was unsure. Apologies. 

I have posted on there, but for some reason my email was denied subscription to the email list, so the post won't be accepted by the list.

Thanks,

Andres

Send a mail there first:
user-subscribe@jmeter.apache.org
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
stategyman@gmail.com
text: Thanks a bunch, the subscribe button in the forums website seems to not be working, but emailing to that email worked.
